intro: Gymnadenia chlorantha, commonly known as the green gentian, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that bear whorled clusters of bright green, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, nutrient-rich soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it blooms from late summer to early autumn. Gymnadenia chlorantha is known for its ornamental value and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
